definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The woman bristled when I asked her to move.
sentences.chinese: 當我叫那女人往前挪動時，她發怒了。

sentences.english: I heard the leather of Baba's seat creaking as he shifted on it.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到爸爸挪動身子，皮椅吱吱作響。

sentences.english: Shortly after, I heard someone moving a bamboo stool.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會，又聽見有人在挪動那竹凳子。

sentences.english: It wstipuls a precious moment I didn't wish to move.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻云云珍貴以至於我沒有念挪動轉移半步。

sentences.english: You move a little to the left, Max.
sentences.chinese: 你往左邊挪動一步，邁克斯。
他笨拙地挪動身體，坐起來。

sentences.english: Anyone knows an ant can't move a rubber-tree plant .
sentences.chinese: 人人都知道一個小小的螞蟻是不能挪動橡膠樹的。

sentences.english: It wphrottoms a precious moment I didn't want to move.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻云云貴重以至於我沒有念挪動轉移半步。

sentences.english: Would you please move your case, it is in the way.
sentences.chinese: 你能把你的箱子挪動一下嗎？它擋路了。

sentences.english: I am a Queen, but I have not the power to move my arms.
sentences.chinese: 我是女王，但是我沒有權力挪動我的胳膊。
向新的發射點挪動轉移。

sentences.english: It was such a precious moment I didn't want to move.
sentences.chinese: 刻如此寶貴以至於我不想挪動半步。

sentences.english: Does your desire to move your legs feel impossible to resist?
sentences.chinese: 想挪動你的腳的慾望是否不可抵抗？

sentences.english: In the face of Mr Li's disapproval, I've changed the position of my desk.
sentences.chinese: 我不顧李先生的反對，挪動了我辦公桌的位置。

sentences.english: When you sit or lie down, do you have a strong desire to move your legs?
sentences.chinese: 當你坐下或躺下時，是否有強烈的慾望想挪動你的腳？

sentences.english: Back in the alley Dick was still trying to get mobile.
sentences.chinese: 回到巷子裏，迪克還在努力挪動着。

definition: out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4

definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
